title: Calculate pi using the Gregory-Leibniz series
description: Write a Python function `calculate_pi(n)` that uses the Gregory-Leibniz series to approximate pi. Use list comprehensions for the first three steps, and your own my_sum function to sum the series.
hints: Generate the first n odd numbers using a list comprehension.
Create a list of alternating signs [1, -1, 1, -1, ...].
Sum the series and multiply by 4 to get the approximation of pi.
